A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I am not disappointed because none of the exciting fan theories or speculation were adhered to\, I even like how the stories of Kylo and Rey are playing out (hence the half star)\, but this honestly took a dump on what made Star Wars special. I don't know how the "Critics Consensus" could be that this honours the saga's legacy. There is no world building. There is no real struggle. There is no tension. There are minimal meaningful character interactions (only Kylo and Rey). Despite the awful kiddy content\, dialogue\, and inconsistencies\, the prequels at least had these.

I'm not even addressing the fact that they ruined Luke.

This is not the Star Wars I was looking for.
